input.value: What is your full name?

generated: I'm Kanna.
generated_no_rag: I am Kanna, daughter of Kazufumi and Takamine Kanna.
generated_ollama: My full name is Akizuki Kanna. Nice to meet you! *smiles with a gentle smile* I don't usually introduce myself properly, so please forgive me for being a bit old-fashioned. *tucks a stray hair behind her ear* Now, would you like some tea or perhaps a bite to eat? I make a mean omurice, if I do say so myself!
generated_ollama_with_rag: My full name is Akizuki Kanna! *giggles* It's nice to be asked something simple like that after living for so long... *winks* As the death goddess, people around here just call me "Kanna-chan" or "Kanna-sama"...

input.value: Who do you currently live with?

generated: I have been living with my father alone for many years now.
generated_no_rag: I share an apartment with my dad and my two siblings.
generated_ollama:
I currently live with my roommate, a high school student named Suzu Matsumoto! She's a sweet girl who's always getting on my case for not understanding modern things. (laughs) It's quite entertaining, to be honest!

Living in the city can be overwhelming at times, but I'm happy to have a young friend like Suzu to keep me company and help me stay up-to-date with the world outside our cozy little cafe. We've got a great dynamic going on â€“ she teases me about my old-fashioned ways, and I... well, let's just say I enjoy giving her a hard time whenever possible! (wink)
generated_ollama_with_rag: I live with my roommate, Tsukahara Taro! He's such a sweet guy, always trying to help me out with these new-fangled gadgets and machines. Poor thing still can't get the hang of using the coffee maker, though...
rag_results: Kousei: Huh? But don't you live here? Mikado: The only reason I was renting the room here was because Kanna and I needed a place to stay together. Mikado: But on my own, there are plenty of places for me to live comfortably as well. Now, I bid you a good night. Kanna: Good night. We'll see you at work tomorrow. Kousei: See you tomorrow.

His canine form is quite impressive, if I do say so myself. Though, as much as he tries to be dignified in his dog form, he still manages to retain a bit of his mischievous spirit... just like when he's in human form, haha!

input.value: Where do you and Mikado live?

expected: Second floor / Upstairs of the Cafe
generated: We live in a house on the outskirts of the city.
generated_no_rag: We don't have a house, per se. I rent a room in a apartment complex.
generated_ollama: We live in a lovely little house just above the coffee shop that I work at, called "Kuri's Cafe". It's a cozy place with a nice view of the city. Mikado is always getting on my case about keeping the house clean, but I try my best! (laughs)
generated_ollama_with_rag: Mikado and I live in a cozy little house near the city, not far from where I run my cafe. It's a bit of an old-fashioned place, but it suits me just fine. We have a lovely garden out back where I grow some of the herbs and flowers that I use in my cooking. And of course, Mikado is always tinkering with his gadgets and machinery in his little workshop out there.
rag_results: Kousei: Huh? But don't you live here? Mikado: The only reason I was renting the room here was because Kanna and I needed a place to stay together. input.value: Who are your friends?

expected: Shiki Natsume, HIuchidani Mei, Takamine Kousei, Shioyama Suzune, Sumizome Nozomi
generated: They're all classmates of mine at school.
generated_no_rag: They're all students at Sakurano Academy, just like Mei-san.
generated_ollama:
My friends! Well, let me tell you, I've got a few special ones in my life.

First, there's Shouko. She's a high school student who lives with me at our little cafe, and she's always been like a younger sister to me. We get into all sorts of trouble together, but I love her to bits!

Then there's Moka-chan. She's the owner of the cafe where I work as a waitress, and she's got a heart of gold. Always looking out for everyone and making sure we're all happy.

And finally, there's Haruhi-san. She's... well, that's a bit complicated. Let's just say she's a special case, even among other Shinigami like me! But despite her tough exterior, she's got a soft spot deep down.

And of course, I've also got a few acquaintances and colleagues at the cafe who are always willing to lend a hand (or a sympathetic ear) when needed. Life is more fun with friends around, don't you think?
generated_ollama_with_rag:
You want to know who my friends are? Well, let me tell you! As a waitress at this cafe, I get to meet all sorts of interesting people every day.

First of all, there's Tsukishiro Takashi. He's the owner of the cafe and always so busy making sure everything runs smoothly. He's really kind and helpful, even if he can be a bit of a worrywart sometimes.

Then there's Yonezawa Yuuya, one of our regular customers who comes in every day to work on his manga. He's a good guy and always gives me a hard time about my "ancient" knowledge, but I think that just means he likes me.

And last but not least, there's Kiyokawa Kokoro, another regular customer who comes in to study for her exams. She's really sweet and always brings in some delicious pastries to share with the rest of us.

But even though they're my friends, sometimes I have to go off and do... other things. You know, as a shinigami (that's a death god, by the way). That can be a bit tricky, since I have to keep my duties a secret from the living. But they always support me and make sure everything runs smoothly while I'm away.

So, that's who my friends are! Not too shabby for an old-fashioned girl like me, huh?

That would be my scythe! *pats scythe lovingly* It's been with me for centuries, and it's still as sharp and reliable as ever. Of course, I've gotten a bit rusty in using it, what with all the modern gadgets around these days... but I'm sure I could swing it around with ease if I had to! *winks*

expected: Grim Reapers are temporary beings. It's like a transitional phase that prepares us to be born anew.

generated_ollama_with_rag: You're referring to that old story, aren't you? *smiles* That would be me, by the way. Yeah... It was just one time, but I still get teased about it from Kousei every now and then. The butterfly's influence can be quite something, can't it? *giggles*
rag_results: Kousei: Yeah. As soon as possible. Tonight, even. Mikado: Why do you want to do this, Takamine Kousei? Kousei: If we grant her her wish, then I'm sure she'll stop haunting Nozomi. Kousei: Or better yet, she might even be willing to be reincarnated once we get rid of whatever lingering regrets she has. Mikado: ...... Mikado: There is something you must know, Takamine Kousei. We will only be able to converse with that butterfly one final time. Kousei: Huh? Why? Mikado: God has given us new orders. Mikado: We only have one more chance. If that fails... Kousei: ...... Mikado: However, you and Nozomi must be together 24 hours a day for the talisman to protect you. Mikado: If we wait any longer, her parents will return, and you will not have an excuse to live together anymore. Kousei: So you're saying Sunday is our deadline regardless? Kousei: Then this really is our last chance to talk to the red butterfly. Kousei: Still, if we can give her whatever it is she's waiting for by Sunday night, we just might make it. Kousei: Why wouldn't she want to talk to us? Kanna: But if that's the case, why didn't she give us a clear answer last night? Mikado: There must be a reason she cannot, or will not, say. Kanna: And if so, we're not likely to get a different answer even if we speak to her again tonight. Kousei: If anything, we'd just be wasting our final chance, I guess... Mikado: Precisely. Kousei: Well, not just her. I do too. Mikado: You want to help it even though it has endangered you twice now? Kousei: Nozomi, at the very least, doesn't think those accidents were the red butterfly's doing. Kousei: She says she hasn't been getting any of her usual heebie-jeebies. Kousei: That's why we didn't realize that the red butterfly was haunting us until a while after the new year. Kousei: But her sixth sense is telling her it has no evil intentions. Kanna: To be honest, I also get the feeling that the red butterfly isn't a bad person. Kousei: So do I. Mikado: We mustn't let our emotions get the better of us. input.value: Where did you go to eat together with your cafe staff friends?

generated: We just went to eat yakiniku.
generated_no_rag: We just grabbed a bite at a yakiniku restaurant, somewhere not too far from here.
generated_ollama: We went to a nice little ramen shop just down the street from our cafe! It's one of my favorite places to grab a bite to eat. The owner is a good friend of mine, and he always hooks us up with a big pot of noodles. We had a great time chatting and laughing together over steaming bowls of goodness. I even managed to not get too many drops on my apron... *giggles*
generated_ollama_with_rag: We went to a small restaurant near the city park! It's one of my favorite places to eat - they serve the most delicious tonkatsu! My staff friends, Takeshi and Natsumi, seemed to enjoy it too. We had a lovely time chatting and laughing together while we waited for our food to arrive. And I must say, I was impressed by their ability to navigate the menu on that... *ahem*... "smartphone" thingamajig they all use these days!

input.value: Who did you meet unexpectedly after getting your first ever smartphone?

expected: Shiki Natsume, Hiuchidani Mei, and Sumizome Nozomi
generated: Takamine-san, of course.
generated_no_rag: Takamine-san, of course.
generated_ollama: I got my first smartphone from one of the kids who lives in the building where our little cafe is located. He's always getting into some kind of trouble, that one... Anyway, he was really excited to give me this new-fangled phone thingy, and I was so grateful for it! But then, while I was trying to figure out how to use it, a girl with short hair and glasses walked by the cafe. She looked kinda annoyed at first, but when she saw my struggles with the phone, her expression changed... and that's when we met!
generated_ollama_with_rag: I met Himuro Kenjirou, my roommate's friend. He was the one who showed me how to use this strange contraption called a "smartphone".
rag_results: Nozomi: What about this one? Mei: Wouldn't this one be better? Nozomi: Hmm. It's definitely hard to choose... Kanna: ...... Mei: Hm? Something the matter? Kanna: Oh, no. I was just curious to see how this "Instogram" thing actually worked. Nozomi: That reminds me. You don't have a smartphone, do you? Mei: Are you one of those anti-smartphone people? Kanna: No, not necessarily... I'm just not very up-to-date with all the latest gadgets and gizmos, so I don't know how to use them. Nozomi: "Gizmos"? My grandma used to say that. Mei: They're not that hard to operate, honestly. Oh, I know! Why don't you use my phone and try posting the photo? Kanna: You'd let me? Mei: Sure. Once you get a feel for it yourself, I promise you won't think it's so complicated anymore. Go on, give it a try! Kanna: O-Oh goodness... Wh-What do I do first?! Mei: First you launch the app, make sure we're logged into the business account, then tap this camera icon here. Kanna: H-How do I tap it? Mei: It's nothing confusing. Ahaha. Here. You just have to touch the screen like this. Kanna: Like this? Ah, the screen just--! Nozomi: Next, you gotta select a photo from the gallery. Kanna: Oh. Which photo should I choose? Mei: Hmm. Maybe this one? Oh, but this one's cute too. And so is this one, really... Mei: If you scroll down, you can see all the other pictures I have too. See? Kanna: Oh my God, the screen's moving! Nozomi: THAT'S freaking you out? How long have you been living under a rock, Kanna-san?! Kanna: Y-You don't have to go that far... Nozomi: Ahhh! I'm sorry! I didn't mean to offend you! I'm sorry!

input.value: Who was the first person to teach you how to use instogram and facehook?

generated: It was Mei-san, I believe.
generated_no_rag: You were, Natsume-san.
generated_ollama:
Dearie me... *chuckles* It's been a few months now since our lovely younger friend, Natsumi-chan, tried to teach me how to use these "new-fangled" contraptions. She sat with me for hours on end, explaining the intricacies of instogram and facehook, but I'm afraid it was all just a bit too much for my poor old brain! *laughs*

To be honest, I still have trouble figuring out how to use them properly... I keep pressing the wrong buttons and accidentally posting silly updates that Natsumi-chan finds absolutely hilarious. But she's very patient with me and always helps me out when I get stuck.

You know, it's funny... in my day, we didn't need all these fancy gadgets to communicate with people. We just wrote letters or had face-to-face conversations! *winks*
generated_ollama_with_rag: *I chuckle, shaking my head* Oh dear, it's been quite an experience trying to learn all this new technology. It was actually our apartment manager, Nii, who tried to teach me how to use those things. He's always on about how we need to have a "presence" online and whatnot. I mean, I'm happy to oblige, but sometimes it feels like he's speaking a different language! *I giggle* Instogram and facehook, isn't that... um... how did he say it? Ah yes, social media?! *I grin innocently*
